title: Dual Effects of the US-China Trade War and COVID-19 on United States Imports: Transfer of China's industrial chain?. (arXiv:2309.02271v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: The trade tension between the U.S. and China since 2018 has caused a steady decoupling of the world's two largest economies. The pandemic outbreak in 2020 complicated this process and had numerous unanticipated repercussions. This paper investigates how U.S. importers reacted to the trade war and worldwide lockdowns due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We examine the effects of the two incidents on U.S. imports separately and collectively, with various economic scopes. Our findings uncover intricate trading dynamics among the U.S., China, and Southeast Asia, through which businesses relocated portions of their global supply chain away from China to avoid high tariffs. Our analysis indicates that increased tariffs cause the U.S. to import less from China. Meanwhile, Southeast Asian exporters have integrated more into value chains centered on Chinese suppliers by participating more in assembling and completing products. translated_title: 美中贸易战和COVID-19对美国进口的双重影响：中国工业链的转移？
translated_abstract: 自2018年以来，美中贸易紧张局势导致全球最大两个经济体的稳步脱钩。2020年爆发的疫情进一步加剧了这一过程，并带来了许多意想不到的后果。本文调查了美国进口商对贸易战和COVID-19大流行的反应。我们分别对这两个事件对美国进口的影响进行了研究，包括各种经济范围。我们的研究揭示了美国、中国和东南亚之间复杂的贸易动态，通过这些动态，企业将全球供应链的一部分从中国转移到其他地方以避免高关税。我们的分析表明，提高关税会导致美国从中国进口的减少。与此同时，东南亚出口商通过更多地参与产品的组装和完成，更多地整合到以中国供应商为中心的价值链中。然而，全球疫情封锁扭转了这一趋势，因为...（待续）
tldr: 美中贸易战和COVID-19大流行对美国进口产生了双重影响。研究发现，为了避免高关税，企业将部分全球供应链从中国转移，东南亚出口商更多地参与中国供应商为中心的价值链。然而，全球疫情封锁扭转了这一趋势。
en_tdlr: The US-China trade war and the COVID-19 pandemic have had dual effects on US imports. Research findings show that to avoid high tariffs, businesses have relocated parts of their global supply chain away from China, while Southeast Asian exporters have integrated more into value chains centered on Chinese suppliers. However, the worldwide lockdowns over the pandemic have reversed this trend.
